benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/allTags - Retrieve account tags

covered: Valid Request: Multiple scenarios exercise successful retrieval with default and explicit parameter combinations (TC01, TC02, TC06).
Empty Response: TC07 covers accounts with no tags (empty JSON array).
Query Parameters: objectType, includedDeleted, and audit query parameters are exercised across many scenarios (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC20, TC21, TC22).
Defaults & Backwards Compatibility: Default behavior / no-query-params and backward compatibility are covered (TC01, TC17).
Error Handling (client): Invalid accountId (malformed UUID) and SQL injection attempts are tested (TC09, TC12).
Error Handling (server/state): Non-existent account and DB-empty scenarios covered (TC08, TC25).
Downstream & timeout errors: Downstream unavailable and timeout behaviours are present (TC11, TC15).
Deleted-tags behavior: Inclusion/exclusion of deleted tags and regression check are covered (TC03, TC16, TC19).
Audit levels: NONE, MINIMAL, FULL are tested (TC01, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC20, TC21).
Integration: Consistency after add/delete via other APIs is covered (TC18, TC19).
Performance & concurrency: Large payload/performance and concurrent-read scenarios covered (TC14, TC23).
Content-Type header: Presence of application/json is validated (TC27).
Edge cases: Min/max parameter combinations and invalid audit value are covered (TC20, TC21, TC22).
Resilience/inconsistency handling: Dependent service inconsistent data scenario is present (TC24).
gaps: Pagination: There are no tests for pagination (offset/limit/cursor) or behavior when results are chunked/streamed; the standard guideline for GET pagination is not covered.
Caching behavior / conditional GET: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional requests using If-None-Match / If-Modified-Since.
Rate limiting / throttling: No explicit tests for rate limiting, throttling responses (e.g., 429) or behavior under burst traffic; concurrency tests do not verify throttling or rate-limit headers.

Full objectType enumeration and invalid values: Only some objectType examples (INVOICE, PAYMENT) are used; the test set does not explicitly enumerate/validate all allowed objectType enum members or boundary/invalid objectType inputs beyond one invalid audit value.
Authorization granularity (403): Tests cover missing/invalid auth (401) but do not cover forbidden access (403) or role/permission based restrictions.
Header validations beyond Content-Type: No checks for other important headers (Content-Length, caching headers, Link for pagination).
500/Internal Server Error: Tests include downstream 503/504 but there is no explicit test for 500 Internal Server Error and how the API surfaces unexpected server errors.

Parameter type coercion/format variations: No tests for alternate boolean representations (includedDeleted=1/true/TRUE/false), case-insensitivity of enum values, or unexpected but well-formed types for query params.

Schema field-level validation: While Tag schema conformance is mentioned, there are no negative tests for missing/extra fields, incorrect types inside Tag objects, or validation of required Tag fields at the field level.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: cover offset/limit or cursor-based pagination, validate Link headers or paging metadata, and behavior when a large result set is requested (including correctness across pages).
Add caching/conditional GET tests: verify ETag and Cache-Control headers, and conditional requests using If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to ensure 304 responses and correct cache behavior.
Add rate limiting tests: simulate burst traffic to verify throttling, expect 429 responses where applicable, and check presence of Retry-After headers.
Enumerate objectType values: add parameterized tests that exercise each allowed objectType enum value and invalid objectType values to validate parsing and error responses.
Add authorization scope/role tests: include 403 Forbidden scenarios for valid tokens without sufficient permissions and validate error messages for least-privilege denial.
Cover 500/Internal Server Error: add tests that simulate internal failures (e.g., DB exceptions) to ensure 500 responses are handled consistently and do not leak internal details.
Parameter format fuzzing: add tests for boolean and enum parameter format variations, unexpected but syntactically valid values, and ensure robust validation/error messages.
Validate response schema fields: include negative tests for Tag field-level validation (missing required fields, incorrect types) and assert strict schema conformance.
Expand header checks: validate Content-Length, character-encoding, and presence/format of any Link or pagination headers when pagination is added.
Clarify and test rate vs concurrency: extend TC23 to include rate-limit verification under sustained high throughput, and ensure behavior is deterministic under load.
